jbt.execution.core
Class ContextFactory

java.lang.Object
  jbt.execution.core.ContextFactory

public class ContextFactory
extends java.lang.Object

The ContextFactory implements the simple factory pattern, and allows clients of the framework to create instances of IContext objects that can be used when running behaviour trees.

Author:
Ricardo Juan Palma Dur√°n

ContextFactory

public ContextFactory()
Method Detail

createContext

public static IContext createContext(IBTLibrary library)
Creates a new empty context (with no variables) that contains all the behaviour trees specified in library.

Parameters:
library - the set of behaviour trees that the returned IContext will contain.
Returns:
a new empty context that contains all the behaviour trees specified in library.

createContext

public static IContext createContext(java.util.List<IBTLibrary> libraries)
Creates a new empty context (with no variables) that contains all the behaviour trees in the libraries libraries.

Parameters:
libraries - the list of libraries whose behaviour trees this context will contain.
Returns:
a new empty context that contains all the behaviour trees in the libraries libraries.

createContext

public static IContext createContext(java.util.List<ModelTask> behaviourTrees,
                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> names)
Creates a new empty context (with no variables in it) that contains all the behaviour trees in behaviourTrees. The name of the trees are specified in names, so, for instance, the i-th element in names represents the name of the i-th tree in behaviourTrees.

Parameters:
behaviourTrees - the list with the trees that the context will contain.
names - the list with the names of the trees.
Returns:
a new empty context that contains all the behaviour trees in the list behaviourTrees.

createContext

public static IContext createContext()
Creates a new empty context (with no variables in it).

Returns:
a new empty context.
